content: raspberry beanie by lauren sanchez this hat was designed to fit snugly with a lot of stretch materials mrs crosby steamer trunk 1 skein 16 circular needles in size 5 and 7 size 7 double pointed needles or size needles for gauge 4 stitch markers sizes small 17 6 med 18 5 large 19 2 x-large 20 gauge 5 stitches to 1 in stockinette stitch pattern stitch broken rib round 1 knit round 2 knit 1 stitch purl 1 stitch abbreviations k knit p purl k2 decrease knit two together ssk slip slip knit through the back loops a left leaning decrease pm place marker begin cast on 88 92 96 100 with larger needle switch to smaller needle place marker join carefully and work in k1 p1 rib for 1 5 switch to larger needle and begin pattern stitch continue in pattern until piece is 4 5 5 5 5 6 measured from the bottom of the ribbing last row worked should be row 2 of pattern stitch at the same time place a marker every 22 23 24 25 stitches on last row of pattern stitch top decreases the top of the hat is worked in stockinette round 1 slip marker k 1 k2 decrease k to 3 st before next marker ssk k1 slip marker k 1 k2 decrease k to 3 st before next marker ssk k1 slip marker k 1 k2 decrease k to 3 st before next marker ssk k1 slip marker k 1 k2 decrease k to 3 st before next marker ssk k1 round 2 knit continue with these two row switching to double pointed needles when stitches no longer slide comfortably around your circulars until you have 16 20 16 20 stitches left on needles 4 5 4 5 between each marker cut your yarn leaving at least an 8 tail pull the tail through the remaining stitches weave in your ends put on your head and head outside
